edu.illinois.mitra.starl.objects

Class TraceWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.illinois.mitra.starl.objects.TraceWriter

  • public class TraceWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    TraceWriter maintains an XML and provides a simple interface for writing system events and variables.
    See Also:
    Traceable

    • Constructor Detail

      • TraceWriter

        public TraceWriter(java.lang.String filename,
                   java.lang.String dir,
                   GlobalVarHolder gvh)
        Create a new TraceWriter and open a file for writing
        Parameters:
        filename - the output filename
        dir - the output directory

    • Method Detail

      • sync

        public void sync(java.lang.String source,
                 long timestamp)
        Write a synchronization tag featuring the sync source and current timestamp. Used to align trace files of the same execution from multiple agents.
        Parameters:
        source - the thread which triggered the synchronization

      • event

        public void event(java.lang.String source,
                  java.lang.String type,
                  java.lang.Object data,
                  long timestamp)
        Write an event tag to the trace file
        Parameters:
        source - the thread in which the event occurred
        type - the event type
        data - (optional) any data associated with the event. If data implements Traceable, the object's getXML() method will be called to write object specific information to the trace file.
        See Also:
        Traceable

      • variable

        public void variable(java.lang.String source,
                     java.lang.String varname,
                     java.lang.Object value,
                     long timestamp)
        Write a variable to the trace file
        Parameters:
        source - the thread in which the event occurred
        varname - the name of the variable
        value - the variable value. If this implements Traceable, the object's getXML() method will be called to write object specific information to the trace file. If the variable object has no toString() method defined, this will not print useful information to the trace.
        See Also:
        Traceable

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the trace file. Must be called before exiting the application to ensure that the trace file is complete.

      • write

        protected void write(java.lang.String text)
        Parameters:
        text - text to write to the trace file

      • writeTag

        protected void writeTag(java.lang.String tag,
                        java.lang.String contents)
        Write a complete XML tag to the trace file
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag label
        contents - the tag contents

      • writeTimeTag

        protected void writeTimeTag(long timestamp)
        Writes an XML tag, time, containing a timestamp

      • open

        protected void open(java.lang.String field)
        Writes an XML opening tag
        Parameters:
        field - the name of the tag to open

      • close

        protected void close(java.lang.String field)
        Writes an XML closing tag
        Parameters:
        field - the name of the tag to close
